docs.snippet: Surgeon-Gen. FINLEY has sent to the hospitals at Washington a newly-invented spring couch, which is intended to take the place of the old fashioned slat cot or bedstead. This new bed is equally adapted to camps and hospitals, and can be taken apart...
docs.lead_paragraph: Surgeon-Gen. FINLEY has sent to the hospitals at Washington a newly-invented spring couch, which is intended to take the place of the old fashioned slat cot or bedstead. This new bed is equally adapted to camps and hospitals, and can be taken apart and tied up almost in a man's handkerchief. The bottom is made of thin slats of pine of the smoothest quality,

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; Five Hundred Millions Already Expended for the War.Satisfactory Nature of the Foreign Dispatches.Remarkably Good Health ofthe Army.An Inquiry to be Made into the Managementof the Hospitals.The Welfare of the National Prisoners. The National Commissioners on Their Way South.The Times Letters from the Burnside Expedition.OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. THIS BURNSIDE EXPEDITION.

docs.lead_paragraph: The full account in the TIMES, yesterday, of the Burnside Expedition was a timely relief, not only to the public, but to the Government. The suspense had become painful, and the brief official dispatch of Gen. BURNSIDE by no means relieved the anxiety.

docs.snippet: In the senate, yesterday, notice was given of a bill to incorporate the Homoeopathic Medical Society of New-York.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the senate, yesterday, notice was given of a bill to incorporate the Homoeopathic Medical Society of New-York.

docs.snippet: The United States steam transport Philadelphia, Capt. BARTON, from Key West, on Jan. 22, arrived at this port yesterday.

headline.main: NEWS FROM ALBANY.; Another Debate is the Assembly on the Finance Resolutions Speech of Mr. Boadle,of Chemung, Mr. Pierce and Others TheElection of Superintendent of Public Instruction and Regent of the University, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most unsatisfactory as well as most difficult, tasks of a correspondent, is to condense speeches, and give their substance in but few lines. Especially is this true of speeches made in debate, where so much oftentimes depends upon a nice discrimination in the use of terms, or a happy use of an opponent's language, against himself.

docs.snippet: In the Senate yesterday, Mr. HENDERSON, recently appointed from Missouri, appeared and took his seat. The Naval Committee asked to be discharged from the further consideration of the memorial asking for a steam mail line to San Francisco.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate yesterday, Mr. HENDERSON, recently appointed from Missouri, appeared and took his seat. The Naval Committee asked to be discharged from the further consideration of the memorial asking for a steam mail line to San Francisco.
